citation.article-title: Pseudonocardia asaccharolytica sp. nov. and Pseudonocardia sulfidoxydans sp. nov., two new dimethyl disulfide-degrading actinomycetes and emended description of the genus Pseudonocardia.

p.s: Description of Pseudonocardia sulfidoxydans sp. nov.
Pseudonocardia sulfidoxydans (sul.fid.ox'y.dans. M .L. fem. adj. sulfidoxydans oxidizing sulfides)
Forms a yellow vegetative mycelium and a white aerial mycelium with long chains of oval spores on TSB agar.
Mycelium fragments into coccoid and rod-shaped elements.
Hyphal segments are sometimes swollen up to 5 Î¼m.
Acid production from glucose, xylose, fructose and trehalose.
No acid from rhamnose, cellobiose, mannitol, sorbitol, erythritol, maltose, lactose, arabinose, adonitol and salicin.

Phosphatidylmethylethanolamine, phosphatidylethanolamine, hydroxyphosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylinositol, phosphatidylinositol mannoside, diphosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylglycerol are present.
The major fatty acids are iso-branched hexadecanoate and hexadecanoate.
Small amounts of 10-methyl hexadecanoate and 10,14-dimethyl pentadecanoate are present.
Strains 591, 592 and 593 were isolated from tree-bark compost biofilters from an animal-rendering plant.
